Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's like they sample the blockchain, and find blockhashes which exceed the target by N number of zeros (1,2,3,...) which they call superblocks, and the make a linked list of those blocks. Since they are randomly located and very hard to predict, they are like compressing the blockheaders into a smaller structure. These things are for SPV wallets to use, instead of downloading all block headers. They don't conflict with notarization and both could be used

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Electrum used to download a large static blockheader file from a centralized server, newer electrums store 1 checkpoint per target interval (2016 blocks for BTC) and verify against that. I think nipowpows could be interesting, but I think they still need data in each blockheader, so you either start with it from genesis or you need some kind of fork to get it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i tried to understand what they mean by "velvet fork" but it just seems like a buzzword to be honest

Author: cipi#4502
Content: @Deleted User that is this "bug": https://github.com/kyuupichan/electrumx/issues/185 and the only workaround is to stop electrumx when this happens, run the `compact_history.py` script and start electrumx agaian... here is the CLI for KMD: `COIN=Komodo DB_DIRECTORY=/electrumdb/KMD ~/electrumx/compact_history.py`

Author: cipi#4502
Content: you could also do this with a cron job, because it happens regularly... how often, depends on the blocktime of the coin

Author: cipi#4502
Content: that is the other possibility to solve it, but it takes much longer üòÉ

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: Fuck you guys are on top of it.  Yeah fees have been a mess for all the equi coins for some time.   It pisses me off that people don't understand how far ahead this project is.  Makes me lose my faith in humanity a little

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it seems that Zcash merged some upstream BTC stuff about "insane fees" (which somebody renamed absurd fees to be politically correct) and there was a bug in it, since BTC deals with fees differently than Zcash, and nobody really noticed, but I did. It effects HushList protocol, which uses amount=0 transactions to use the memo field for "free", other than xtn fee

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: with that PR, you can now use the memo field for "free" and blend into the rest of network traffic with a default fee, before, you could not, you had to use a custom fee <= to your amount, or 0 for amount=0, which really stands out

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i can send you a simple 1 commit PR for the absurd fee bug if you want, zcash made me change various things and it turned into a bunch of commits that might be annoying for you to cherry-pick/rebase

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i recommend all ZEC-derived coins merge that in, regardless of their overwinter stance, since it doesn't depend on the network upgrade at all. this is the beginning of me getting out that message, I guess. Go forth and spread the knowledge

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, that sounds like a good plan

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: working on the `getsnapshot` RPC was really fun, and will make so many things much easier, airdrops, calculating dividends for supernet assets, notary node voting asset chains, ...

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am amazed that it can snapshot KMD in 12 seconds, i thought it would be longer. BTCH holds the record for KMD AC's, since it inherited all utxos from BTC, it has way more than KMD to process

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: most AC's are very fast, my testing was with AXO and it was about 0.5 seconds consistently
